page.title: 03Landscape around Langho (2)
page.content: Only half the Parsonage reservoir is in this section , it supplies Blackburn . East of York by a minor road to Whalley is a small steep rocky area of common land called Cronshaw Chair . Apart from houses , farms and churches , covered elsewhere , the only large group of buildings is named Langho Centre , until recently a mental hospital now for sale ; several brick built wards and service blocks surrounded by lawns and gardens occupies 1250 m off the A59 . Two elderly people's homes and a purpose built orphanage are at Wilpshire . The double track railway is now used almost entirely for cement and lime from Clitheroe . The A59 and the A666 both carry heavy traffic .
